channel.title: Sudoku solver (updated)
channel.description:
when i first released my sudoku solver, mopar commented on how it was only for win32, and thought it could be improved by porting it to other platforms using a library. well, i decided to do just that, and i used wxWidgets. i only have binaries for windows and linux (i just downloaded ubuntu the other day), but the code should be able to be compiled on all other platforms that wxWidgets supports.
[url=http://capndurk.myweb.uga.edu/code/sudokusolver.exe]sudokusolver.exe[/url] [url=http://capndurk.myweb.uga.edu/code/sudokusolver-ubuntu]sudokusolver-ubuntu[/url] [url=http://capndurk.myweb.uga.edu/code/sudokusolver.cpp]sudokusolver.cpp[/url] [url=http://capndurk.myweb.uga.edu/code/sudokusolver.h]sudokusolver.h[/url]
also, i'm pretty new to linux, and i was wondering... what versions of linux (has to support gtk+) will this binary made in ubuntu work on? is it only ubuntu/kubuntu/xubuntu or are there others?
thanks

item.title: Sudoku solver (updated)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

oh, i didn’t even consider static linking… thanks a lot!

Read full topic

item.title: Sudoku solver (updated)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Very nice, it looks and runs great (requires wxwidgets 2.8, default installed is 2.6 but you can have both versions at once, so its fine), and I’m glad you made it cross platform, awesome.

seand:

also, i’m pretty new to linux, and i was wondering… what versions of linux (has to support gtk+) will this binary made in ubuntu work on? is it only ubuntu/kubuntu/xubuntu or are there others?

Good question, I’ll answer it as best I know how. Since the program is dynamically linked (uses my libraries, if you included all the libraries with it it should be able to run everywhere) it will look for libraries in the /lib directory (which is probably in an environmental variable) and so should run under any distribution that has this variable, if it for some reason can’t find the library it can be tricked with various export commands telling it exactly where to look. But since you provided sourcecode it isn’t something you really have to worry about.

Read full topic
